title: "Tanks are overpowered because they can deal a lot of damage while being nigh invulnerable"

replies.body: Then you watch a tank vs tank battle and realize they don't actually do that much damage but the people claiming they do a lot of damage just have absolutely no defenses against their small damage.

This is true. I would like to point something out, though. While you may say, "Tanks should do a lot of damage to squishies because they build no defense", wouldn't it also be true to say, "Carries should be able to tank damage from tanks because they build not a single damage item"?

That being said, people that typically complain about tanks are those than can't farm well enough to keep up with them. Because damage will typical outscale defense.
So if an ADC built one defensive item, should they be nigh invulnerable? Same idea.
They are, to an extent. An ADC with say, spirit visage as a sixth item isn't really at any risk of dying against a maokai built normally.

Tanks have, even after armor pen, around 9000-10000 effective hp, and deal much more than a third of an adc's damage if they're itemizing for it, which means many tanks can in fact duel an adc.

A implies B
Does not guarantee that 
B implies A

They're contrapositives.

In this case; B, therefore A is false because were it true that squishies could absorb damage from tanks without a problem, then it would necessarily be the case that the tank is redundant. A tank being unable to distract or otherwise incapacitate the squishy means that the tank is irrelevant to the fight.

It does not necessarily have to be the case if you feel that the role of tank is unnecessary to the game; however, since tanks are a part of the balance paradigm, it stands that they need to be able to fulfill their role through threat of damage and crowd control.

A implies B is true, in this case, because a tank has to be able to be a threat to squishies in order to maintain value.

There's a lot more nuance to the tank v carry balance, like the scaling that you already alluded to.

I'm not saying it's out of balance. I think League is best when tanks are strong because they can counter assassins. I said that the people who typically complain "omg nurf tanks" are those than can't cs well, so they fall behind the power curve.

My point was just to say that I think the argument of "adcs build no defense so they die" is very flawed.

That's a relative standpoint. Watching a tank vs tank battle - they don't do anything to each other because they have all the defense, don't care about each other's CC and take no damage because of their large HPs.
When you watch an ADC die in 5 hits to a tank, than that's an issue.
The worst offenders are tank bruisers, like Fiora used to be.
Wet noodle fight :D

Basically, yea. Watching tanks duke it out is like watching them fight with wet noodles.
However, examining what their definition of a wet noodle is is closer to a heavy duty chain-like barbed wire for a squishy.
Their builds are full of on-hit damage, defense and HP, passive item damage + their abilities.
I'm not saying that they can't be countered, i'm saying that armor and HP scale all to easily in their favor early game and that delaying the carries' build is always a good call to make.

You know, I'm actually fine with tanks dealing reasonable damage as long as they don't have high mobility. They need damage because if they aren't a threat why would you bother hitting them? What I'm not okay with is them getting that damage for free because there ratios are too high. That way there is some degree of give and tank. You want a heavy hitter, wont be as hard to kill. Want a invulnerable wall, won't hit that hard. Honestly what I think kills LoL tanks for me is the fact that a lot of "meta" ones have high mobility on top of naturally high damage, and thats not right. Things like Cho'Gath are fine, they don't really move that fast, but are very hard to kill and will rip your face off and force feed it to your buddy. Gragas is another example of a good tank. Hes hard to kill and has good mobility, but sacrifices damage. Things that break the game are Tanks  like Ekko who has insane mobility, can build almost full tank and still gets really really good AP of a handful of low-cost items that potentially still give tank stats. You can have 2 of the 3 tank attribute but if a champion can have all three in good standing theirs a real problem.

Ekko isn't a tank though, the issue isn't tanks, it's non tanks building tank and still having so much damage that they can still maul someone to death. There's just too much damage in the game right now.

...Right. Trolling it is. But just in case you're at all serious:

The criteria for surviving a caster are much different from those for surviving an autoattacker. An autoattacking ADC will kill a tank before a mage is able to start a second spell rotation, _because their autoattack has a half-second cooldown._ Meanwhile, the mage has to go through three rotations to finish the job.

By the way, the high armor items that make it "easy" to get 300 total armor also grant 0 health and are somewhat situationally useful. A tank is likely to have maybe 200-250 armor unless they're purposefully stacking it (similarly, they will probably not have more than ~160 MR). And just so we're clear, if a tank has 300 bonus armor, Lord Dominik's Regards will be a 60% increase in damage output against them. It's not remotely "useless", and every ADC with any sense will build it _every time_ there is a tank stacking armor. Even at normal tank armor levels, it's ~45% extra damage. Even at "ADC bought GA" levels, it's a ~13% increase. If the enemy builds basically any armor, Last Whisper beats any flat pen. There's no reason not to build it, unless you want to do something gimmicky like 100% crit or 50% life steal. Don't do something gimmicky. Buy armor pen.

Oh, and Blade of the Ruined King is a better tank-buster than any AP item, even after the on-hit nerf.
yes but a mage can blow an adc up with 2-3 spells at full build at a far range so before the adc can attack the tanks he would die

...Unless the tank and support on the ADC's team can peel properly. Yes, I know. These are fundamentals of the game. Whichever team can rock-paper-scissors their way through a teamfight better wins. That's how it works.

_The point,_ though, was that despite your claims, ADCs are better tank-busters than mages, and that is by design. With that in mind, I somewhat disagree with the parent comment here: we _don't_ need better AP tank-busting items. Mages aren't as good at killing tanks, and they're not meant to be.

Well, do you mean AP carry, or do you specifically mean AP _casters_? Someone like Elise (if built bruiser) has little problem with tanks, because her engagement pattern includes a lot of sustained damage. The autoattacks are the main thing. Low cooldown attacks with no resource cost are the things that beat tanks. If you have a bursty mage who has cooldowns to deal with, of course they're going to struggle with targets that survive their burst.

That said, they have been nerfing the hybrid/bruiser items (Titanic Hydra, Sterak's Gage, Maw of Malmortius, and now Iceborn Gauntlet). I get the feeling real tank items (i.e. Frozen Heart and the like) aren't the things you have a problem with.
